Welcome to your Japanese lesson on Making Complex Sentences. This builds on the basics you have covered so far and introduces how to combine sentences in different ways.
Our first example is how to combine two sentences with 'and'. In Japanese, 'and' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For example, if you have these two sentences: "I eat rice. I drink water.", you can combine them into "I eat rice, and I drink water." which in Japanese it is:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私はご飯を食べます、そして水を飲みます。

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
A complex sentence in Japanese might be "I went to an electronics shop, and bought a camera for my friend." in Japanese the sentence is:

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は電気店に行って、友達のためにカメラを買いました。

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: Now let's take a look at how to say 'because' in Japanese. 'Because' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . As an example, "I study Japanese because I want to live in Japan." becomes

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は日本に住みたいなぜなら、日本語を勉強します。

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
Finally, let's learn how to use 'but' in Japanese. 'But' is

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang: . For instance, "I want to go to Tokyo, but I don't have money." translates to

lang.mstts:prosody: 私は東京に行きたい、でもお金がありません。

voice.name: en-US-RyanMultilingualNeural
voice.lang:
.
This concludes our lesson on making complex sentences in Japanese. Please continue practicing these sentence structures and soon you'll find forming complex sentences in Japanese an easy task. Until the next lesson, happy learning!
